question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionGasEvent::to_erased()] [Cost Validation] Does to_erased validate that the cost field in Bytecode events is non-negative and within expected bounds, or can corrupted ExecutionGasEvent instances propagate invalid costs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionGasEvent::to_erased()] [Loc Event Handling] For Loc events that set cost to 0, can an attacker spam these events to create massive gas profiling trees that consume memory without actually paying gas? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: CallFrame::to_erased()] [Recursive DoS] Can deeply nested Call events within CallFrame.events create recursive to_erased calls that overflow the stack, especially for transaction batches with many nested function calls? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: CallFrame::to_erased()] [Collection Explosion] Does the map operation on self.events properly handle cases where events vector contains thousands of entries, potentially allocating excessive memory for children vectors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: CallFrame::to_erased()] [String Formatting] Can malicious function names or module IDs in FrameName::Function cause the Render formatting to produce extremely long strings, exhausting memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: CallFrame::to_erased()] [Type Safety] Does the conversion correctly maintain the invariant that Call frames always have cost 0 at the top level, or can manipulated CallFrame data cause non-zero costs to appear at frame level? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionAndIOCosts::to_erased()] [Total Mismatch] Can the total field in TypeErasedExecutionAndIoCosts diverge from the actual sum of tree node costs, allowing validators to disagree on final gas amounts and break consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionAndIOCosts::to_erased()] [Gas Scaling Factor] Does the gas_scaling_factor field get properly propagated without modification, or can it be manipulated during conversion to alter final gas calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionAndIOCosts::to_erased()] [Node Order] Does the order of nodes pushed (intrinsic, keyless, dependencies, call_graph, ledger_writes) matter for cost calculation, and can reordering cause different total gas values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionAndIOCosts::to_erased()] [Empty Dependencies] When dependencies vector is empty, does skipping the dependencies node creation cause any inconsistencies in tree structure or cost accounting? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionAndIOCosts::to_erased()] [Keyless Cost] Can the keyless_cost field be manipulated to zero to bypass authentication gas charges, or is it properly enforced regardless of this profiling representation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionAndIOCosts::ledger_writes()] [Transient Cost] Does transaction_transient properly default to 0 via unwrap_or_else when None, or can edge cases cause this to panic and crash validators during profiling? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionAndIOCosts::ledger_writes()] [Write Op Accumulation] Can malicious transactions create thousands of write_set_transient entries that cause excessive memory allocation when converting to Node trees? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionAndIOCosts::ledger_writes()] [Events Explosion] Does the events_transient vector have size limits, or can attackers emit millions of events to exhaust memory during Node tree construction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: ExecutionAndIOCosts::ledger_writes()] [Cost Validation] Are the costs in transaction_transient, events_transient, and write_set_transient validated to be non-negative before creating Nodes, preventing negative gas charges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: StorageFees::to_erased()] [Total Verification] Can the total field in TypeErasedStorageFees diverge from the sum of txn_storage plus all write_set_storage and events costs, breaking economic invariants? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: StorageFees::to_erased()] [Zero Refund] Does the transaction storage node correctly use Fee::zero() for refund, or can non-zero refunds on transaction storage fees create economic exploits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: StorageFees::to_erased()] [Parent Node Costs] Are the parent nodes for 'writes' and 'events' correctly set to (Fee::zero(), Fee::zero()), or can non-zero parent costs cause double-counting? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: StorageFees::to_erased()] [Vec Init Pattern] Does the #[allow(clippy::vec_init_then_push)] pattern hide any potential issues with node ordering or memory allocation during vector construction? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: WriteStorage::to_erased()] [Key Rendering] Can malicious StateKey values in WriteStorage cause the Render operation to produce excessively long strings or special characters that break downstream parsing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: WriteStorage::to_erased()] [Cost-Refund Pair] Does the tuple (self.cost, self.refund) properly preserve both values without overflow or loss during conversion to StoragePair? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: WriteStorage::to_erased()] [Op Type Validation] Can WriteOpType be Creation, Modification, or Deletion with arbitrary cost/refund combinations, or are there constraints that prevent economic exploits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: WriteTransient::to_erased()] [Transient Costs] Are WriteTransient costs properly validated to match WriteStorage costs, or can discrepancies between transient and storage representations cause consensus failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: EventStorage::to_erased()] [Type String Length] Can extremely long type canonical strings in EventStorage.ty cause memory exhaustion when creating Node text fields? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-profiling/src/erased.rs] [Function: EventStorage::to_erased()] [Zero Refund Assumption] Is it correct that events never have refunds (always Fee::zero()), or can this assumption be violated in edge cases, causing incorrect refund calculations? (Medium)
